definitions.definition: To enclose or surround.
definitions.example: The inner city was ringed with dingy industrial areas.

definitions.definition: To make an incision around; to girdle.
definitions.example: They ringed the trees to make the clearing easier next year.

definitions.definition: To attach a ring to, especially for identification.
definitions.example: We managed to ring 22 birds this morning.

definitions.definition: To surround or fit with a ring, or as if with a ring.
To rise in the air spirally.
To steal and change the identity of (cars) in order to resell them.
Of a bell, etc., to produce a resonant sound.
definitions.example: The bells were ringing in the town.

definitions.definition: To make (a bell, etc.) produce a resonant sound.
definitions.example: The deliveryman rang the doorbell to drop off a parcel.

definitions.definition: To produce (a sound) by ringing.
definitions.example: They rang a Christmas carol on their handbells.

definitions.definition: To produce the sound of a bell or a similar sound.
Of something spoken or written, to appear to be, to seem, to sound.
To telephone (someone).
definitions.example: I will ring you when we arrive.

definitions.definition: To resound, reverberate, echo.
To produce music with bells.
To repeat often, loudly, or earnestly.
The sound of something that rings.
The quality of being resonant.
A technique used in the study of wild birds, by attaching a small, individually numbered, metal or plastic tag to their legs or wings.
The theft of cars and illegally changing their identities for resale.
Loud and clear.
Made forcefully; powerful.
